poem:
**The Alchemy of Vanity**

In the mirror's gaze, she conjures the glow,  
page by page the columnist spins tales  
of potions promising the stars,  
while jars align in quiet anticipation,  
waiting to transform the morning face—  
brief rituals in pursuit of beauty's grail,  
as if serums could hold  
the secret to time's whispered grace.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Everything I’ve learned as a beauty columnist about the products that actually work, from £17 body cream to LED masks I’ve been writing about beauty for almost two decades, and in that time my ardent pursuit of hacks and game-changing advice has had two goals: to make my routine faster, and to get a better overall effect. Over the last few years, my weekly columns for the Guardian have taken that quest to the next". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
